record.field: This Agreement is entered into between the Company and the Contractor for the deployment of skilled manpower to support Ready-Mix Concrete (RMC) operations. The parties acknowledge the scope, responsibilities, and commercial terms defined in the following clauses and annexures.

The Contractor shall provide labour services for Ready-Mix Concrete (RMC) operations, including but not limited to:

  • Plant operation support
  • Loading / unloading of materials
  • Transit mixer assistance
  • Maintenance team activities (mechanical, welding, electrical)
  • housekeeping and General labor
This Agreement shall remain valid for (12) months ommencing from 1st October 2025, unless terminated earlier under Any Clause.

The Contractor shall comply with all applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to:

  • Minimum Wages Act
  • EPF & ESI provisions
  • Insurance (WC / ESI) for all deployed personnel
  • Safety & PPE norms as instructed by the Company

• Post-wise headcount, shift timings, and rates shall follow Annexure A (Manpower Matrix).
  • Daily attendance shall be maintained in the Company’s attendance system and will be the basis for certification and billing of the fixed component (Part-A).

• Contractor shall maintain daily labour logbook and diesel performance records; maintenance/breakdown events shall be logged with evidence.
  • Monthly performance score shall be computed by the Company based on diesel efficiency, maintenance compliance and attendance.
  • If the overall performance star rating falls below the average benchmark, the contract may be subject to review or warning notice by the Company.
  • The Contractor shall cooperate with the Company in maintaining accurate and verified daily diesel performance records to ensure transparency and timely payment.

Billing shall comprise the following components:

  • Part-A (Fixed): Attendance-linked fixed component as per Annexure A.
  • Part-B (Variable): Production-linked rate per m³, payable Only if monthly production meets or exceeds MGQ (Minimum Guaranteed Quantity) as per Annexure B..
  • If MGQ is not met due to Contractor-responsible causes, Part-B may be held or prorated as per Company policy.
  • Applicable Taxes and deductions (TDS/GST) shall be applied as per law.
Advance, if given against PDC cheque guarantee, shall be adjusted in future payments, and the cheque will be returned upon settlement

• The Contractor shall ensure all deployed manpower follows site safety instructions at all times.
  • Safety shoes shall be provided and maintained by the Contractor
  • Reflective jackets, helmets, and gloves shall be provided by Rach Infrastructure (OPC) Pvt. Ltd.

9.1 Breakdown Recording:

    All Emergency, LOTO, and Scheduled breakdowns shall be duly recorded with their start and end times, along with identification of responsibility. In the event of downtime arising due to the Contractor’s non-responsibility, Part-B deductions shall be applicable.

    9.2 NGT / Government Mandated Shutdowns:

    In the event of long-term NGT bans or any government-mandated shutdowns, the Company shall retain only minimum essential staff (for example, one Senior BPO and two Helpers) for ensuring plant safety and supervision.

    9.3 Standby Allowance:

    For such retained staff, a daily standby allowance shall be payable at a mutually agreed rate between the Company and the Contractor.

    9.4 Continuation of Maintenance Activities:

    Where maintenance activities continue during such shutdowns, the maintenance team shall remain entitled to their full fixed salary.

    9.5 Suspension of Maintenance Activities:

    Where maintenance activities are also suspended, the salary cost of the retained staff shall, subject to mutual consent, be shared equally (50:50) between the Company and the Contractor, based on verified attendance records.

    9.6 FoFairness Provision:

    This clause is intended to ensure fairness and mutual cooperation between the Parties during unavoidable shutdowns. For the avoidance of doubt, where the Monthly Guaranteed Quantity (MGQ) is fully achieved, there shall be no impact on the Contractor’s invoice, notwithstanding any temporary stoppages.

    Illustration: In a month of 30 days, if 10 days are lost due to NGT shutdown but the MGQ of 3000 cum is achieved within the remaining 20 days, no deduction shall apply.

1. Mandatory KYC Records

The Contractor shall ensure that the KYC documents of all deployed personnel (existing and future) are submitted to the Company prior to their deployment. The following documents are mandatory for each employee:

  • Aadhaar Card (proof of identity and address)
  • PAN Card (if available)
  • Recent passport-size photograph
  • Bank account details (cancelled cheque or passbook copy)
  • Emergency contact number and residential address
  • Police verification certificate (where applicable)

2. New Joinees

No employee shall be allowed to commence work at the site without submission of the complete KYC set to the Company.

3. Exits / Transfers

The Contractor shall maintain records of employees who leave employment, including exit clearances. Updated manpower lists shall be shared with the Company from time to time.

4. Company’s Right

The Company reserves the right to deny site access to any employee whose KYC documents are incomplete or not submitted.
